arts.ttl: Wales will attack Belgium after beating Liechtenstein - Bellamy
arts.sum: Head coach Craig Bellamy vows that Wales will attack Belgium on Monday after beating Liechtenstein to go top of their World Cup qualifying group.
Watch the highlights as Wales beat Liechtenstein.

arts.ttl: Wales brush aside Liechtenstein to maintain Bellamy’s unbeaten reign
arts.athr: Sarah Rendell at Cardiff City Stadium
arts.sum: The unbeaten reign of Craig Bellamy continued as his Wales side propelled themselves to the top of their World Cup qualifying group with a thumping win. Bellamy was appointed head coach in July 2024 and the national side have drawn four and won five under him. Wales leapfrogged North Macedonia, who drew 1-1 to Belgium on Friday. The Red Devils are only just getting their qualifiers under way because they were involved in Nations League playoffs in March. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Wales ease past Liechtenstein as promising form under Bellamy continues
arts.sum: Joe Rodon, Harry Wilson and Kieffer Moore were all on target as Wales eased past Liechtenstein 3-0 in their World Cup Qualifier at the Cardiff City Stadium.

arts.sum: Wales kept up their unbeaten start to the 2026 World Cup qualifying campaign with a straightforward 3-0 win

arts.ttl: Wales vs Liechtenstein – Predicted lineup and team news
arts.sum: Wales will look to continue their strong start to World Cup qualification when Liechtenstein arrive at the Cardiff City Stadium on Friday. Craig Bellamy’s side have taken four points from their opening two fixtures, beating Kazakhstan on home soil before a 96th-minute equaliser earned a point in North Macedonia.
